column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: Our employees are our most important assets. Protecting, promoting and enhancing the health and wellbeing of our people is as vital as protecting their safety. We do this by identifying and managing the critical occupational health risks they are exposed to. It includes minimising occurrences of occupational illness, supporting our people to lead healthy lifestyles that contribute to their fitness for work, and helping them remain healthy as they travel and work at our more remote sites.

column6: Occupation health and safety management system
column13: This standard applies to employees and contractors working at all Rio Tinto business units and managing operations through all stages of their lifecycle, from exploration to closure. This standard applies to all electrical work above 110 volts DC or 50 volts AC.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation
column13: The framework for analysing and managing risk must include: a) understanding the context and initiating the risk process; b) identification of hazard and risk scenarios; c) evaluation of risk and assigned ownership; d) management of risks through the implementation of existing and further controls; e) documentation, communication and reporting of hazard and risk information; and f) updating hazard and risk information periodically. The HSEC risk management group procedure must be used for analysing and managing health, safety, environmental, community, and social performance risks.

column6: Hazard identification, risk assessment, and incident investigation

column6: Occupational health services
column7: We ran 2 workshops for our global health and hygiene practitioners to share learnings, best practices, and recent technology developments in the Southern and Northern hemispheres. We completed occupational and industrial hygiene monitoring at our operational and managed assets. It included analysis of noise, airborne particulates, gas and other contaminants that can lead to adverse health effects for our employees and contractors. It helped us better understand our exposure profile and prioritise actions to implement adequate controls.

column6: Workers covered by an occupational health and safety management system
column7: We firmly believe all fatalities are preventable. Our focus remains on identifying, managing and, where possible, eliminating risks to ensure everyone, including partners and colleagues at our non-managed operations, goes home safely every day. Our all-injury frequency rate (AIFR) was 0.37 in 2023, an improvement from 2022 (2022: 0.40). We continue to see a disparity in safety performance for employees compared to contractors, so our focus remains on improving contractor safety by further integrating contractors into our safety culture.

column6: Work-related injuries
